feat.title: Aberrant Mark of Contagion
feat.benefit: Whenever you hit an enemy with a daily attack power, that enemy takes a -2 penalty to saving throws against ongoing damage until the end of the encounter.
You are immune to the negative effects of diseases from sources that are more than 5 levels lower than you, though you still carry and spread those diseases.

feat.title: Aberrant Mark of Madness
feat.benefit: Whenever you hit an enemy with a daily attack power, that enemy takes a -2 penalty to Will until the end of the encounter.
You are immune to the negative effects of madness from sources 5 levels lower than yourself.

feat.title: Aberrant Mark of Terror
feat.benefit: Whenever you hit an enemy with a daily attack power, that enemy takes a -1 penalty to attack rolls against you until the end of the encounter. This is a Fear effect.
You are immune to the negative effects of Fear and intimidation from sources 5 levels lower than yourself.

feat.title: Aberrant Sight
feat.benefit: You gain darkvision.

feat.title: Academy Prodigy
feat.benefit: You gain a +3 feat bonus to two skills from the artificer's class skill list. This counts as the Skill Focus feat for these skills.

feat.title: Accidental Tells
feat.benefit: When you make an Insight check against a creature within range of your mantle of misfortune, you can roll twice and take the better result.

feat.title: Accurate Magic Armaments
feat.benefit: Whenever you use an Artificer power that targets a weapon or an implement, the next attack roll with that weapon or implement before the end of the encounter gains a +1 bonus.

feat.title: Accursed Challenge
feat.benefit: Whenever a creature marked by you makes an attack that does no include you as a target, the target takes a -2 penalty to saving throws until the start of its next turn.

feat.title: Accursed Coordination
feat.benefit: You can place your warlock's curse on a creature that is already affected by another character's curse.
In addition, you have combat advantage against any creature affected by more than one warlock's curse.

feat.title: Accursed Isolation
feat.benefit: If you target only one creature with maledictor's doom, the penalty to attack rolls increases to -3, or to a -5 penalty to triggered attack rolls.

feat.title: Accursed Revelation
feat.benefit: When you first drop to 0 power points during an encounter, each enemy within radius of your Ardent Mantle grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Acid Splash
feat.benefit: When you miss with a Wizard power with the Acid keyword and would not normally deal damage to the target, you deal acid damage equal to your Constitution modifier + your implement's enhancement bonus.

feat.title: Acid Wash
feat.benefit: When you use acid surge, you ignore the immobilized, restrained, and slowed conditions during the move.

feat.title: Acolyte of Divine Secrets
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Religion skill.
Choose a 1st-level Invoker at-will attack power. You can use that power as an encounter power.
In addition, you gain proficiency in Invoker implements.

feat.title: Acolyte of the Veil
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Acrobatics or Stealth skill.
You can use shadow step as an encounter power.
In addition, you gain proficiency in ki focuses.

feat.title: Action Grant
feat.benefit: When you roll initiative at the start of an encounter, you can give your action point to an ally you can see. The action point must be spent before the end of the encounter.

feat.title: Action Recovery
feat.benefit: When you spend an action point to take an extra action, you can make a saving throw against each effect on you that a save can end. Take the extra action after you have made all saving throws.

feat.title: Action Rush
feat.benefit: When you spend an action point to take an extra action, you can shift 2 squares as a free action either before or after taking the extra action.

feat.title: Action Surge
feat.benefit: You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls you make during any extra action you gain by spending an action point.

feat.title: Active Familiar
feat.benefit: When you take a move action, you can also move your familiar its speed or shift it 1 square.

feat.title: Adamantine Mind
feat.benefit: When you use your iron mind, you gain a +4 bonus to all defenses instead of +2.

feat.title: Adaptable Breath
feat.benefit: Choose a type of damage your dragon breath doesn't already deal from among acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.
When you use your dragon breath, you can choose to use this damage type rather than the normal damage dealt by the power. Only one damage type and keyword applies to a given attack.
feat.special: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you select this feat, choose another damage type for your dragon breath that you don't already have for it.

feat.title: Adaptable Nature
feat.benefit: Whenever any creature you can see succeeds on a skill check, you gain a +2 feat bonus to that skill until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Adept Dilettante
feat.benefit: You can use your Constitution, Wisdom, or Charisma to determine bonuses to attack rolls and damage with the power you chose for your Dilettante racial trait instead of the ability that power normally uses.
feat.special: This feat counts as a class-specific multiclass feat for the class from which your Dilettante power comes.

feat.title: Admixture Breath
feat.benefit: When you use your dragon breath, you can choose for it to deal two types of damage and gain both keywords. Both damage types must be ones you are capable of delivering with your dragon breath.

feat.title: Advantage of Cunning
feat.benefit: When you slide an ally with your Virtue of Cunning feature, you can also slide an enemy that was adjacent to that ally into the space the ally vacated.

feat.title: Advantageous Eye
feat.benefit: When you hit a target with your evil eye of the Vistani, the target grants combat advantage to all your allies for the duration of the power.

feat.title: Advantageous Perspective
feat.benefit: When you make a melee attack, you score a critical hit on a natural roll of 19 or 20 against targets that grant you combat advantage and are at least two sizes larger than you (Large, if you are Small).

feat.title: Advantageous Rebuke
feat.benefit: When you hit with an attack that is benefitting from a bonus to the attack roll from preserver's rebuke, the target also grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Aegis Accuracy
feat.benefit: If a target marked by you makes an attack that doesn't include you as a target, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls against the marked creature until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Aegis Vitality
feat.benefit: If a target marked by you makes an attack that doesn't include you as a target, you gain 5 temporary hit points.
These temporary hit points increase to 10 at 11th level, and 15 at 21st level.

feat.title: Aerenal Arcanist
feat.benefit: Choose an additional power for each level of utility power you know from an arcane class. Each time you learn a new level of utility powers for an arcane class, choose an additional one of the same level.
After an extended reach, choose which arcane utility power of each level you can use for that day. This feat does not change the number of arcane utility powers you can use each day.
If you use a Spellbook, the additional utility power is in addition to any you gain from that feature.

feat.title: Aerenal Half-life
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to damage rolls with necrotic powers.
This bonus increases to +3 at 11th level, and +4 at 21st level.
In addition, you also gain the bonus to attack rolls with necrotic powers you make during any extra action you gain by spending an action point.

feat.title: Against All Odds
feat.benefit: If, at the start of your turn, three or more enemies are adjacent to you, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of your turn.
The bonus to damage rolls increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Aggressive Advantage
feat.benefit: You gain combat advantage against all enemies until the end of your first turn in each combat.

feat.title: Aggressive Assault
feat.benefit: At the beginning of an encounter, whenever you hit a target that has not yet acted, you slide that target 1 square.

feat.title: Aggressive Construction
feat.benefit: When you use a psionic power to summon a creature, each enemy adjacent to the creature when it appears takes psychic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

feat.title: Aggressive Familiar
feat.benefit: Replace one of your 16th-level or higher utility powers with the aggressive familiar feat power.

power.title: Aggressive Familiar
power.fluff: As you use an arcane power, your familiar explodes, damaging creatures you hit

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: Your familiar must be in its active state

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Your familiar is destroyed, and you gain a +5 power bonus to damage rolls against creatures that were adjacent to your familiar. The bonus lasts until the end of the current turn.

feat.title: Aggressive Leadership
feat.benefit: While you are conscious, bloodied allies who can hear and see you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls.

feat.title: Aggressive Spirit
feat.benefit: Whenever you reduce an enemy to 0 hit points with a spirit attack power, you can teleport your spirit companion 10 squares to a square adjacent on an enemy as a free reaction.

feat.title: Agile Athlete
feat.benefit: When you make an Acrobatics check or an Athletics check, roll twice and use the higher result.

feat.title: Agile Brawler
feat.benefit: You gain the Fighter feature Combat Agility

feat.title: Agile Command
feat.benefit: Any ally who starts his or her turn adjacent to you gains a +2 bonus to AC and Reflex against attacks triggered by his or her movement.

feat.title: Agile Form
feat.benefit: When you use your wild shape to change from your humanoid form to a beast form, you shift 1 square.

feat.title: Agile Hunter
feat.benefit: When you score a critical hit with a melee attack against your quarry, you can shift 1 square as a free reaction.
In addition, the enemy takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Agile Opportunist
feat.benefit: When you end a pull, push, or slide in a square where an enemy is within your reach, you can use an immediate reaction to make a melee basic attack against that enemy.

feat.title: Agile Running Attack
feat.benefit: When you move as part of using a Ranger attack power, you ignore difficult terrain.

feat.title: Agile Stand
feat.benefit: Once per turn when you stand up from prone, you can also shift 1 square.

feat.title: Agile Superiority
feat.benefit: The attack bonus for your Combat Superiority uses your Dexterity modifier instead of your Wisdom modifier.

feat.title: Airspur Windrider
feat.benefit: You subtract 10 feet from the distance you fall before determining falling damage.
This increases to 20 feet subtracted at 21st level.

feat.title: Alacrity of Fortune
feat.benefit: Whenever an ally within the radius of your Adent Mantle makes a save, he or she can shift 1 square as a free reaction.

feat.title: Alchemical Affinity
feat.benefit: Once per attack when you hit an enemy using a consumable alchemical item attack power, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier.
These temporary hit points increase to 3 + your Constitution modifier at 11th level, and to 6 + your Constitution modifier at 21st level.

feat.title: Alchemical Blood
feat.benefit: Choose one damage type from the following: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, or thunder.
When you use an attack power or an alchemical item attack power with the chosen keyword, you gain a +1 feat bonus to the damage roll.
This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.
Additionally, while you have any temporary hit points, you gain an untyped +1 bonus to damage rolls with alchemical item attack powers.

feat.title: Alchemical Opportunist
feat.benefit: If you have an alchemical item in hand when an enemy provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use that alchemical item instead of making a melee basic attack.

feat.title: Alchemist
feat.benefit: You can make alchemical items of your level or lower. You must have the correct formula and training in an appropriate skill.
You learn two formulas of your level or lower when you first take this feat.
feat.special: If you receive the Ritual Caster feat from a class feature, you can choose to gain this feat instead. If the feature grants you additional rituals known, you instead gain alchemical formulas at the same rate.

feat.title: Alert Familiar
feat.benefit: While your familiar is in its passive form, enemies don't gain the normal benefits of combat advantage against you. Any additional benefits derived from combat advantage still apply.

feat.title: Alertness
feat.benefit: You cannot be surprised.
Also, you gain a +2 feat bonus to Perception checks.

feat.title: Alhahn's Mindful Relocation
feat.benefit: When you use your Shifting Fortunes, you can shift your speed instead of 3 squares.

feat.title: All-Seeing Eye of the Guardian
feat.benefit: Allies adjacent to you cannot be flanked.

feat.title: Allegiance to the Daughter
feat.benefit: Whenever you reduce an enemy you have cursed to 0 hit points or less with a warlock attack, the enemy's space fills with hellfire until the end of your next turn.
Any creature that enters or starts its turn in the flames takes fire damage equal to 5 + one-half your level.

feat.title: Allied Opportunity
feat.benefit: Whenever you attack a creature with enforce challenge, one ally of your choice that is adjacent to the same creature can make a melee basic attack against it as an opportunity interrupt after your attack has been resolved.

feat.title: Ambush Tactics
feat.benefit: The first enemy you damage during the first round of an encounter takes 1d6 extra damage if it has not acted yet.
This damage increases to 2d6 at 11th, and 3d6 at 21st level.

feat.title: Ancestral Battle Accuracy
feat.benefit: You can use your elven accuracy to reroll attack rolls of a single close or area Weapon attack power against every target you choose while wielding a scimitar, double scimitar, falchion, shortbow, or spear.

feat.title: Ancestral Wrath
feat.benefit: While you are bloodied, you gain a +1 bonus to speed.

feat.title: Anchoring Push
feat.benefit: When you use your forceful push, you also slow the target until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Ancient Covenant of Nessus
feat.benefit: When you use a divine encounter or daily attack power on your turn, instead of your normal covenant manifestation, you can allow one target of the power to make a basic attack as a free reaction.
If the target makes this attack, it takes fire damage equal to 5 + your Intelligence modifier after resolving the attack.
This fire damage increases to 10 + your Intelligence modifier at 11th level, and to 15 + your Intelligence modifier at 21st level.

feat.title: Ancient Lore of the Dawn War
feat.benefit: You have studied the lore of old deities and the history of the Dawn War: you gain a +2 feat bonus to History and Religion checks, and you gain the Supernal language.

feat.title: Ancient Soul
feat.benefit: Your dragon breath power is considered an arcane attack power.
In addition, if your dragon breath deals damage of the same type as your Dragon Magic feature gives you resistance to, you gain the following benefit:
Whenever you take damage of the type dealt by your dragon breath (after the damage dealt is reduced by your resistance), you regain the use of your dragon breath if you have already expended it.

feat.title: Ancient Stone
feat.benefit: When your stone's endurance racial power ends, you gain resist 10 to all damage as an aftereffect until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Ancient Wisdom
feat.benefit: When you use your voyage of the ancients power, the enemy you choose also grants combat advantage to each ally adjacent to your spirit companion until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Angelic Harrier
feat.benefit: When you hit only one target with an Invoker ranged encounter or daily attack, you can slide the target 1 square after the power has been resolved.

feat.title: Angelic Protection
feat.benefit: When you use lay on hands, you can choose for the target to gain temporary hit points equal to the number of hit points it would have regained.

feat.title: Anger Unleashed
feat.benefit: The first time you are bloodied during an encounter, you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Angry Grandfather
feat.benefit: You gain a bonus to death saving throws equal to 1 + the number of Rage powers you have expended since your last extended rest.

feat.title: Animal Empathy
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Nature checks.
Also, when you would make an Insight check against a natural beast, you can make a Nature check instead.

feat.title: Ankle Biter
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 feat bonus to damage rolls against creatures larger than you.
This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and +3 at 21st level.
Also, when you score a critical hit against a creature larger than you, the creature takes 1d6 extra damage.
This extra damage increases to 2d6 at 21st level.

feat.title: Ankle Cutter
feat.benefit: When you hit a target that is at least two sizes larger than you (Large, if you are small) and would deal Sneak Attack damage against that target, you can forgo rolling two of your Sneak Attack dice.
If you do so, you cause the target to be slowed until the end of your next turn.
Using this option count as using Sneak Attack for the turn, even if you end up not rolling any Sneak Attack damage.

feat.title: Ape's Reach
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Athletics checks.
Additionally, when you are in beast form and you are bloodied, you gain +1 reach with melee basic attacks.

feat.title: Arbiter of Justice
feat.benefit: You deal +2 damage against bloodied targets.
Additionally, whenever an ally bloodies or reduces your oath of enmity target to 0 hit points, you may act as though you had bloodied or reduced the target to 0 hit points, as appropriate.

feat.title: Arcane Admixture
feat.benefit: Choose one arcane power that you know, and choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.
The chosen power now deals the chosen damage type in addition to its normal damage type and gains that keyword.
Each time you gain a level, you can choose to reassign either the power to which this feat's effect applies or the additional damage type applied (or both).
feat.special: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you select this feat, choose a different power. You can't apply this feat to the same power more than once.

feat.title: Arcane Aegis
feat.benefit: Choose a Swordmage Aegis Style.
You gain the chosen style power, and can use swordmage aegis as an encounter power.

feat.title: Arcane Familiar
feat.benefit: You gain a familiar.
For each Familiar feat you have beyond this one, your familiar gains a +1 bonus to all defenses.

feat.title: Arcane Fire
feat.benefit: When you hit a target with an arcane fire power, that target gains vulnerable 5 cold against the first arcane attack power you use against it before the end of your next turn.
This vulnerability increases to vulnerable 10 cold at 21st level.

feat.title: Arcane Flexibility
feat.benefit: When you score a critical hit with a sorcerer power, you can change the damage dealt by the power to a damage type you have resistance or immunity to.

feat.title: Arcane Fury
feat.benefit: When you use your furious assault racial power to deal extra damage to the target of an area or close arcane power, you deal the extra damage to all targets you hit with the power, not just one.

feat.title: Arcane Implement Proficiency
feat.benefit: Choose a type of implement that any arcane class is proficient in.
You gain proficiency in that kind of implement. If the implement is also a weapon, you do not gain proficiency in using it as a weapon.

feat.title: Arcane Initiate
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Arcana skill.
Choose a 1st-level wizard at-will attack power. You can use that power as an encounter power.
In addition, you gain proficiency in Wizard implements.

feat.title: Arcane Leech
feat.benefit: When you use an arcane daily attack power with your arcane defiling, each target hit with the attack cannot regain hit points until the end of your next turn.
If you hit at least one target with the attack, you also regain hit points equal to half of your healing surge value.

feat.title: Arcane Malice
feat.benefit: Whenever you make an arcane daily attack, choose one creature you hit with that attack.
You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls against the chosen creature until the end of the encounter.
If you have the Student of the Plague feat, you also gain +1 attack bonus against that creature until the end of the encounter.

feat.title: Arcane Mastery
feat.benefit: You can spend an action point to regain the use of a wizard daily attack power you've already used today, instead of taking an extra action.

feat.title: Arcane Porter
feat.benefit: Your familiar can pick up and carry an unattended object weighing 5 pounds or less.
It can hold only one object at a time.

feat.title: Arcane Prodigy
feat.benefit: You gain training in Arcana.
Once per encounter as a free action, you gain a +2 bonus to your next damage roll.
This bonus increases to +3 at 11th level, and +4 at 21st level.
In addition, you gain proficiency in Sorcerer implements.

feat.title: Arcane Reach
feat.benefit: When using an arcane close attack power, you can choose a square within 2 squares of your space as the origin square. In all other ways, the power is still a close attack.

feat.title: Arcane Repositioning
feat.benefit: On your turn, you can use a free action to expend your fey step to teleport one of your conjurations or a creature you have summoned rather than yourself.
If you do so, select one conjuration or summoned creature within 5 squares of you and teleport it 5 squares.
You cannot teleport a conjuration larger than 1 square or a summoned creature that size Large or larger.

feat.title: Arcane Reserves
feat.benefit: If all your arcane encounter attack powers are expended, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with your arcane at-will attack powers until the end of your encounter or until you regain the use of one or more of your arcane encounter attack powers.
This bonus increases to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Arcane Ritualist
feat.benefit: Choose one ritual that you know.
Change the key skill of that ritual to Arcana and you gain a +2 bonus to skill checks as part of that ritual.
Each time you learn a new ritual, you can change the ritual affected by this feat to the newly learned ritual.
feat.special: You can select this feat multiple times. Each time you select this feat, choose a different ritual.

feat.title: Arcane Spellfury
feat.benefit: When you hit an enemy with a sorcerer at-will attack power, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls against that enemy until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Arcane Trapsmith
feat.benefit: You can use your Intelligence modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier when making Thievery checks to disable traps or open locks.
Also, you gain a +4 feat bonus to Arcana checks related to traps or hazards.

feat.title: Arcane Vampire
feat.benefit: Once per encounter, when you hit at least one enemy with an arcane encounter attack, you gain a healing surge.

As a nonaction interrupt before rolling damage for an arcane encounter attack power, you can lose a healing surge to gain a bonus to the triggering power's damage roll equal to your Charisma modifier.
This bonus damage increases to 3 + your Charisma modifier at 11th level, and 6 + your Charisma modifier at 21st level.

feat.title: Archer Captain
feat.benefit: You and any ally within 5 squares of you ignore the penalty to ranged attack rolls at long range.

feat.title: Arcing Throw
feat.benefit: When you use a spear as a thrown weapon, the target doessn't gain cover from its allies.

feat.title: Ardent Tsucora Initiation
feat.benefit: When you use ardent outrage, each target treats squares adjacent to you as difficult terrain until the end of its next turn.

feat.title: Arena Battle Rhythm
feat.benefit: Whenever you make melee or close Weapon attack with one of your arena weapons and deal no damage, the target of your attack takes damage equal to your Dexterity modifier.

feat.title: Arena-Fighter's Recovery
feat.benefit: When you use your second wind, you gain a bonus to damage rolls with your arena weapons until the end of your next turn. The bonus is equal to your Dexterity modifier.
The damage bonus increases to 2 + your Dexterity modifier at 11th level, and to 4 + your Dexterity modifier at 21st level.

feat.title: Argent Falcon
feat.benefit: You replace one utility power of 6th level or higher with the argent falcon feat power.

power.title: Argent Falcon
power.fluff: Your familiar briefly transforms into a silver falcon, and shines with pure moonlight

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of your next turn, your familiar sheds bright light in its space and each square within 3 squares of it. Enemies within the light grant combat advantage.

feat.title: Armor Endurance Training
feat.benefit: You ignore the check penalty to Strength- and Constitution-based skills for wearing armor with all armors you are proficient in.

feat.title: Armor Expertise
feat.benefit: You ignore the check penalty to skills for wearing armor with all armors you are proficient in.

feat.title: Armor Nimbleness Training
feat.benefit: You ignore the check penalty to Dexterity-based skills for wearing armor with all armors you are proficient in.

feat.title: Armor of Burning Wrath
feat.benefit: Your armor of wrath power deals fire and radiant damage and gains the Fire keyword.
The target also takes a -1 penalty to saving throws until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Armor of Winter
feat.benefit: Your armor of wrath gains additional benefits against undead:
► An undead target takes an additional 1d6 cold damage, and the power gains the Cold keyword when targeting undead.
This additional damage increases to 2d6 at 21st level.
► An undead bloodied by the attack is also immobilized until the end of its next turn.

feat.title: Armor Proficiency (Chainmail)
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with chainmail armor.

feat.title: Armor Proficiency (Hide)
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with hide armor.

feat.title: Armor Proficiency (Leather)
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with leather armor.

feat.title: Armor Proficiency (Plate)
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with plate armor.

feat.title: Armor Proficiency (Scale)
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with scale armor.

feat.title: Armor Snag
feat.benefit: You've learned to use your armor and shield to injure any opponent foolish enough to grab you.

When wearing plate armor you are proficient with or wielding a shield you are proficient with, a creature takes damage equal to 2 + one-half your level when you escape that creature's grab or when that creature escapes your grab. A creature can take damage from this only once per turn.
A creature that swallows you or uses a similar ability takes this damage at the end of its turn as long as you remain swallowed or similarly held.

feat.title: Armor Specialization (Chainmail)
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to AC when wearing chainmail armor you are proficient in.
Also, you ignore the penalty to speed for wearing chainmail armor.

feat.title: Armor Specialization (Hide)
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to AC when wearing hide armor you are proficient in.
In addition, the first time you take damage, you reduce it by 5. After you've used your armor to reduce damage, you can do so again once you have settled it back in position as part of a rest.
This reduction increases to 6 at 16th level, 7 at 21st level, and 8 at 26th level.

feat.title: Armor Specialization (Leather)
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to AC when wearing leather armor you are proficient in.

In addition, you are an expert at making your leather armor the difference between a light or grievous wound. Once per encounter when an attack against your AC would be a critical hit, you can spend a free interrupt to turn it into a normal hit instead.

feat.title: Armor Specialization (Plate)
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to AC when wearing plate armor you are proficient in.
In addition, the first time you take damage, you reduce it by 8. After you've used your armor to reduce damage, you can do so again once you have settled it back in position as part of a rest.
This reduction increases to 10 at 16th level, 12 at 21st level, and 14 at 26th level.

feat.title: Armor Specialization (Scale)
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to AC when wearing scale armor you are proficient in.

In addition, you are an expert at making your scale armor the difference between a light or grievous wound. Once per encounter when an attack against your AC would be a hit or a critical hit, you can spend a free interrupt to turn it from a hit to a miss or from a critical hit to a normal hit instead.

feat.title: Armored by Faith
feat.benefit: When you use a Channel Divinity power, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.
These temporary hit points increase to 3 + your Wisdom modifier at 11th level, and to 6 + your Wisdom modifier at 21st level.

feat.title: Armored Sorcerer
feat.benefit: When you are wearing leather armor you are proficient in, any resistance you have gained through your Spell Source feature increases by 2.
This benefit increases to 3 at 11th level, and to 5 at 21st level.

feat.title: Armored Warlord
feat.benefit: You gain one Armor Proficiency feat of your choice without having to meet the ability score prerequisites.
In addition, your number of healing surges increases by 1.

feat.title: Armored Warrenguard
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency in chainmail armor and scale armor.
If you already had proficiency with one or both, you instead ignore the penalty to speed for wearing chainmail or scale armor you are proficient in.
In addition, you gain a +1 bonus to AC against attacks from Large or larger enemies.

feat.title: Artful Provocation
feat.benefit: When you are missed by an opportunity attack, you gain combat advantage against the attacker until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Ascendant Lineage
feat.benefit: When you use your memories of a thousand lifetime and the triggering roll still fails, you regain the use of memories of a thousand lifetimes at the start of your next turn.

feat.title: Aspect of the Cultivator
feat.benefit: Replace one of your Nature's Aspect options with the aspect of the cultivator.
You can use the balm of the cultivator power while you are in this aspect.

power.title: Balm of the Cultivator
power.fluff: Your enemy's attack releases healing energy within you, which you use to aid your friend

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: An enemy damages you with an attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target can spend a healing surge to regain hit points equal to his or her healing surge value.

feat.title: Aspect of the Elements
feat.benefit: Replace one of your Nature's Aspect options with the aspect of the elements.
You can use the fury of the elements power while you are in this aspect.

power.title: Fury of the Elements
power.fluff: You channel elemental power used against you and unleash its fury against your foes

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You take cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You take half damage from the triggering attack, and this power has the keyword or keywords for the triggering attack's damage type or types.
Your first attack before the end of your next turn deals 1d6 extra damage of the type or types dealt by the triggering attack.

feat.title: Assassin's Challenge
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency in holy symbol implements.
In addition, whenever a creature takes damage from your divine sanction, that creature takes 1 extra damage for each of your shrouds on it.
This extra damage increases to 2 per shroud at 11th level, and to 3 per shroud at 21st level.

feat.title: Assassin's Cloak
feat.benefit: Whenever you become invisible, you can make Stealth check to hide as a free reaction.

feat.title: Assassin's Escape
feat.benefit: You can use your shade form power as an immediate interrupt triggered by you taking damage.

feat.title: Assured Healing
feat.benefit: When you miss with a divine attack power with the Healing keyword, and that power does nothing on a miss, you or one ally within 5 squares of you regains regains hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.
The hit points regained increase to 5 + your Charisma modifier at 21st level.

feat.title: Astral Elixir
feat.benefit: When you use shielding elixir, the target gains radiant resistance in addition to the resistance the power normally grants. The radiant resistance is equal to the resistance normally granted and has the same duration.

Also, when making a saving throw, the target can end the shielding elixir's effect as a free interrupt to add 1d6 to the saving throw result instead of gaining the normal benefit for ending the effect.

feat.title: Astral Enmity
feat.benefit: If you use your memory of a thousand lifetimes racial power to increase an attack roll against your oath of enmity target, you deal extra damage equal to the bonus gained from the racial power.
This extra damage increases to twice the bonus to attack at 11th level, and to three times the bonus to attack at 21st level.

feat.title: Astral Fire
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to damage with powers that have the Fire or Radiant keyword.
This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and to +3 at 21st level.

feat.title: Astral Preservation
feat.benefit: When you use your preserver's rebuke power, each ally within 2 squares of you gains a +1 bonus to all defenses against attacks made by bloodied creatures. This bonus lasts until the end of the encounter.

feat.title: Astral Renewal
feat.benefit: Whenever your Astral Resistance racial trait reduces the damage you take from an enemy's attack, you gain a +2 bonus to the next attack roll you make before the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Audacious Crow
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Thievery checks.
This bonus increases by +1 for each member of your Team within 10 squares who is trained in Thievery or has this feat. The maximum total bonus from this feat is +5.

feat.title: Auspicious Lineage
feat.benefit: When you use your memories of a thousand lifetimes racial power, you add 1d8 to the triggering roll instead of 1d6.

feat.title: Autohypnosis
feat.benefit: Your number of healing surges increases by 1.
While you are not bloodied, when you would make an Endurance check, you can make an Arcana check instead.

feat.title: Avalanche Reaver
feat.benefit: When you hit with a charge attack, you can also push the target of the charge 1 square. If the attack already pushes, increase the distance by 1 instead.
If you pushed the target of your charge attack, you can shift 1 square into any square the target just vacated.

feat.title: Avandra's Boon
feat.benefit: When you roll a natural 1 on an attack roll or saving throw, you gain a +2 bonus to your next roll of the same type you make before the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Avandra's Covenant
feat.benefit: When you use a divine encounter or daily attack power on your turn, you can allow an ally within 10 squares of you to make a saving throw instead of using your covenant manifestation.

feat.title: Avandra's Gift
feat.benefit: When you use your second chance racial power and the enemy's attack misses, you gain combat advantage for the next attack you make against that enemy before the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Avenger's Fortunes
feat.benefit: Whenever you spend a healing surge, you can shift 1 square as a free reaction.
If you have an oath of enmity target, this shift must take you closer to or into a square adjacent to that target.

feat.title: Avenging Allure
feat.benefit: When you use your bond of censure power, add 2 to the number of squares you can pull the target.

feat.title: Avenging Opportunist
feat.benefit: The first time in an encounter when you reduce your oath target to 0 hit points or less, you gain an extra move action that you must be used before the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Avenging Resolution
feat.benefit: When you attack your oath target with a Weapon attack, treat all rolls of 1 or 2 on the damage dice as though the result were a 3 on the die.
If your weapon's damage is 1d4 or 2d4, treat rolls of 1 as though the result were a 2 on the die instead.

feat.title: Avenging Spirit
feat.benefit: When an ally of your level or higher is reduced to 0 hit points or fewer, you gain an action point that must be used before the end of your next turn or it is lost.
You must see or hear the ally when he or she is reduced to 0 hit points or fewer to gain this feat's benefits.

feat.title: Avenging Surge
feat.benefit: When an ally hits your oath target, you gain temporary hit points equal to 3 + 3 per ally adjacent to the that target.
These temporary hit points increase to 4 + 4 per ally adjacent at 21st level.

feat.title: Avernian Emissary Wrath
feat.benefit: Once per encounter, when you miss a target that has your shrouds on it, you can use your infernal wrath racial power against it.
This does not expend infernal wrath and can be done even if it is expended.

feat.title: Avowed Dragonfoe
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls against dragons.
This bonus increases to +2 when you are bloodied.
In addition, when you score a critical hit against a dragon with a melee or close attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to the dragon's level.

feat.title: Awaken Aspect
feat.benefit: When you complete a short rest, you can exchange your current aspect of nature for another one.

feat.title: Awaken God Fragment
feat.benefit: The god fragment within you awakens to strengthen your connection to your divine patron and improve the flow of energy into your being.

Choose a god fragment that corresponds with the deity you serve. The fragment grants you a constant benefit as well as a divine manifestation that you can use once per encounter to enhance a divine encounter attack or daily attack. The fragment also describes personality quirks that might manifest.

feat.title: Awakened Potential
feat.benefit: You gain the Psionic Augmentation class feature and 1 power point.
You can spend this power point to augment powers, feats, or magic items that are Augmentable. Once you spend this power point, you do not regain it until you take an extended rest.
You also qualify for feats that require the Psionic Augmentation class feature.
You gain an additional power point at 21st level.
feat.special: When you take this feat, choose Ardent, Battlemind, or Psion. This feat counts as a multiclass feat for that class.

feat.title: Axe Expertise
feat.benefit: When you make a Weapon attack with an axe, you can reroll one [W] of damage, or 2[W] for a daily attack. You must use the second result.
The number of [W] you can reroll increases to 3[W] for a daily attack at 11th level, and to 2[W] for all attacks and 5[W] for a daily attacks at 21st level.

feat.title: Axe Mastery
feat.benefit: When you make a Weapon attack with an axe, you can score a critical hit on a natural roll of 19 or 20.

feat.title: Axe Strike
feat.benefit: When you miss a target with a Weapon attack using an axe and would deal no damage to it, you can expend your power strike to deal damage equal to your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus.

feat.title: Baalzebul's Desperate Gambit
feat.benefit: When you first become bloodied in an encounter, you can roll a saving throw with a bonus equal to the number of enemies adjacent to you.
If you succeed, you can spend a healing surge to regain hit points equal to your healing surge value. If you fail, you lose a healing surge.

feat.title: Back to the Wall
feat.benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to blocking terrain, you gain a +1 bonus to melee attack rolls and AC, and a +2 bonus to melee damage rolls.

feat.title: Backbreaking Staff
feat.benefit: When you use backstab on an attack using a staff, on a hit the target is also dazed until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Backstabber
feat.benefit: The extra damage dice from your Sneak Attack class feature increase from d6 to d8.

feat.title: Bael Turath Ancestry
feat.benefit: Your racial fire resistance increases to 5 + your level.

feat.title: Baleful Malediction
feat.benefit: Whenever you use a divine encounter or daily attack power on your turn, each target hit by the power takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls against you until the start of your next turn.

feat.title: Balican High Praetor
feat.benefit: Whenever an enemy under your warlock's curse drops to 0 hit points, you gain the following benefit in addition to regaining your fell might:

► The next ally you can see that hits with a damaging attack before the start of your next turn subjects its target to your curse. If the target is already under your curse, the ally's attack instead deals extra damage equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier.
This extra damage increases to 5 + your Intelligence modifier at 11th level, and to 7 + your Intelligence modifier at 21st level.

You can enhance powers associated with this feat with your fell might. When you hit an enemy with such a power, each ally adjacent to the target can either shift 1 square as a free reaction or gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the start of your next turn.

feat.title: Balican Praetor
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Diplomacy checks.

When you enhance your hand of blight, you can forgo the extra damage the enhancement would deal to instead grant the target vulnerability to all damage equal to your Intelligence modifier until the start of your next turn.
Each time the target takes damage while it has this vulnerability, reduce the vulnerability by 1 (to a minimum of 0).

feat.title: Bard Implement Mastery
feat.benefit: When you wield a bard implement while using an arcane power, you can score a critical hit on a natural roll of 19 or 20.

feat.title: Bard of All Trades
feat.benefit: You gain a +3 feat bonus to all untrained skill checks.

feat.title: Bardic Dilettante
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Bard's class skill list.
You can use the Bard's majestic word as a daily power once per day.
In addition, you gain proficiency in bard implements.

feat.title: Bardic Knowledge
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Arcana, Dungeoneering, History, Nature, Religion, and Streetwise checks.

feat.title: Bardic Ritualist
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Arcana skill.
You gain the Bard class' Bardic Training class feature.
In addition, you gain proficiency in bard implements.

feat.title: Bardic Wayfarer
feat.benefit: Once per turn when you teleport an ally with a power, you can also teleport 1 square as a free reaction.
If you have the majestic word class power, you can teleport the target 1 square instead of sliding it.

feat.title: Battering Shield
feat.benefit: When you are wielding a heavy shield and push or slide a target with a melee attack, you can move that target 1 additional square.

feat.title: Battle Acumen
feat.benefit: You gain the Fighter feature Combat Superiority.

feat.title: Battle Awareness
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Fighter's class skill list.

Once per encounter, when an enemy that is adjacent to you shifts or makes an attack that does not include you as a target, you can make a melee basic attack against that enemy as an immediate interrupt.

feat.title: Battle Berserker
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Barbarian's class skill list.
You also gain the Savage Rage class feature, but can only enter a Rage once per day.

feat.title: Battle Cadence
feat.benefit: When you use majestic word, you can slide the target 1 extra square.
The target also gains a +2 bonus to the next damage roll he or she makes before the end of her next turn.
This damage bonus increases to +3 at 11th level, and to +4 at 21st level.

feat.title: Battle Caster Defense
feat.benefit: You gain a +4 bonus to AC against opportunity attacks when using a ranged or an area power.

feat.title: Battle Cleric Armaments
feat.benefit: You gain proficiency with light shields, and with one military weapon of your choice.
If you already have proficiency with light shields, you instead gain proficiency with heavy shields.

feat.title: Battle Hardened
feat.benefit: You gain a +5 bonus to saving throws against Fear effects.
In addition, you gain a +2 feat bonus to Initiative checks.

feat.title: Battle Healer
feat.benefit: When you use your healing word power, you regain hit points equal to your Strength modifier after the power has been resolved.
This increases to 3 + Strength modifier at 11th level, and to 6 + Strength modifier at 21st level.

feat.title: Battle Instructor
feat.benefit: You gain the Warlord feature Combat Leader.

feat.title: Battle Intuition
feat.benefit: You can use your Wisdom modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier to determine your Initiative bonus.
In addition, you gain a +2 feat bonus to Initiative checks.

feat.title: Battle Psion
feat.benefit: You gain a +3 feat bonus to damage rolls with Psion powers that have the Force or Psychic keyword. This bonus increases to +4 while you have no power points remaining.
These bonuses increase to +4 and +6 at 21st level.

feat.title: Battle Song Expertise
feat.benefit: When using a weapon you are proficient with or a bard implement, you gain the following benefits with Bard powers:
► +1 bonus to attack rolls with powers that deal no damage.
► +1 to the number of squares that you can pull, push, or slide creatures.

feat.title: Battle Trample
feat.benefit: You gain the battle trample power.

power.title: Battle Trample
power.fluff: You incite your mount to stamp, read, and kick unpredictably, with any foe that remains too close taking damage and being driven back

section.name: Target:
section.text: A mount you are riding and that has a trample power

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the start of your next turn, any enemy that ends its turn adjacent to the target takes 3 damage, and is pushed 1 square from the target. The effect ends if you are no longer riding the target.

feat.title: Battle-Scarred Veteran
feat.benefit: While you are bloodied, you gain the following benefits with Martial at-will attacks:
► If the attack grants temporary hit points and you currently have none, you gain a +1 bonus to the attack roll.
► If the attack allows you to move, you gain resist all equal to your Constitution modifier against any opportunity attacks triggered.
► If you hit, the target gains vulnerable all equal to your Wisdom modifier against the first opportunity attack that hits it before the start of your next turn.

feat.title: Battlemind Duulora Initiation
feat.benefit: When you use Speed of Thought, each enemy that is adjacent to you at the end of the move is marked until the end of its next turn.

feat.title: Battlemind Menace
feat.benefit: When you use your blurred step power, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the start of your next turn.

feat.title: Battlewise
feat.benefit: You can use your Wisdom modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier when you make an Initiative check.

feat.title: Beast Form Eyes
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Perception checks.
In addition, when you are in beast form, you gain low-light vision.

feat.title: Beast Guidance
feat.benefit: Your beast companion gains a +2 feat bonus to any skill in which you are trained.

feat.title: Beast Protector
feat.benefit: If an enemy makes a melee attack against your beast companion, doing so provokes an opportunity attack from you.
If you are adjacent to your beast companion, you can make the attack even if the triggering enemy is not within your reach (you attack the enemy's reaching limb, for instance).

feat.title: Beast Rider
feat.benefit: If your beast companion is your size or larger, and at least Medium size, you can ride it as a mount. This is an exception to the rule that mounts must be no smaller than Large.
You can mount or dismount your beast companion as a move action.

feat.title: Beast Training
feat.benefit: Your beast companion gains training in a skill of your choice.
If you change beast companions, you can also change the skill that this feat grants to your beast companion.
feat.special: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you select this feat, your beast companion gains training in another skill.

feat.title: Beast Within
feat.benefit: While bloodied, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

feat.title: Beasthide Shifting
feat.benefit: While you are under the effect of your razorclaw shifting or longtooth shifting racial power, you gain resist 2 to all damage.
This increases to resist 4 at 21st level.

feat.title: Beatific Healer
feat.benefit: When you use a divine Healing power, add your Charisma modifier to the hit points the recipient regains.

feat.title: Becomer
feat.benefit: When you select this feat, you must choose one race that you can imitate with your changeling disguise racial power.
You learn one language known by the race you chose. If the race can choose any language, so can you.

Also, you gain a +2 racial bonus to one skill to which the chosen race gains a bonus to. If the race does not gain a bonus to any skill but gains training in a skill, you gain the bonus to that skill. If the chosen race can choose a skill to be trained in, you can choose a skill to gain the bonus to from the same choices.
Additionally, when using your changeling disguise racial power to imitate your chosen race, you gain an additional +5 bonus to avoid detection.

feat.title: Befuddling Thoughts
feat.benefit: You can expend your send thoughts as a free action to enhance your changeling trick.
When enhanced, it gains the Psionic keyword and its range changes to Ranged 20.

feat.title: Beginner's Luck
feat.benefit: Before making an untrained skill check, choose even numbers or odd numbers.
If the result of the d20 roll for that skill check matches the kind of number selected, you gain a feat bonus to that skill check equal to one-half your Charisma modifier.

feat.title: Beguiling Enchantment
feat.benefit: Whenever you hit an enemy with a Charm power, that enemy takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls against you until the end of its next turn.

feat.title: Beguiling Torment
feat.benefit: Whenever you daze or stun and enemy using a psionic power, you can spend 1 power point slide that enemy 1 square.

This forced movement increases to 2 squares at 11th level. Starting at 21st level, you can automatically slide an enemy 1 square when you daze or stun that enemy, and can spend 1 power point to increase the forced movement to 3 squares.

feat.title: Bel's Impending Victory
feat.benefit: When you hit a bloodied enemy, your allies gain a 1 bonus to attack rolls against that target until the start of your next turn or until the enemy is no longer bloodied, whichever comes first.

feat.title: Beneath Notice
feat.benefit: When you and an ally are adjacent to the same enemy that is larger than both of you, you gain combat advantage against that enemy.

feat.title: Benefit of Foresight
feat.benefit: When you make an Intimidate check against a creature you can see, you can roll twice and take either result.

feat.title: Benighted Birthright
feat.benefit: You gain resist 5 necrotic and a +2 feat bonus to saving throws against Necrotic effects.
The resistance increases to resist 10 at 11th level, and to 15 at 21st level.

feat.title: Berserk Vitality
feat.benefit: When you enter Rage, you gain temporary hit points equal to one-half your healing surge value.
If you are bloodied when you enter Rage, you gain temporary hit points equal to your full healing surge value.

feat.title: Beseech Patron
feat.benefit: You can use your Pact Boon with the following trigger in addition to its normal trigger:
Trigger: You spen an action point to gain an extra action and use an arcane daily power with the action

feat.title: Beshaba's Boon
feat.benefit: Each time an enemy fails a saving throw against an effect you imposed, you gain 5 temporary hit points.
These temporary hit points increase to 10 at 11th level, and to 15 at 21st level.

feat.title: Bestial Death's Door Ferocity
feat.benefit: Your beast companion gains a +1 bonus to attack rolls while bloodied.
In addition, if your beast companion is reduced to 0 hit points or less, it can make a melee basic attack as a free interrupt.

feat.title: Bestial Stability
feat.benefit: When you and your beast companion are adjacent to each other, you can either increase or decrease the distance of any forced movement movement against either you or your companion (but not both at once) by 2 squares.
Also, while adjacenet to your companion, you can stand from prone as a minor action.
Finally, when your beast companion is adjacent to you and would be knocked prone, you can attempt a saving throw to keep it standing.

feat.title: Betrayal of Body
feat.benefit: While you are suffering ongoing damage that lacks a type, you can transfer the ongoing damage to one ally adjacent to you as a free action. You can do this only once per round.
When you transfer the ongoing damage, its damage increases by 5.

feat.title: Betrayal of Zerthimon
feat.benefit: When you target an enemy with your assassin's shroud power and that enemy has not yet acted in the encounter, the enemy grants combat advantage until the start of your next turn.

feat.title: Binding Ensnarement
feat.benefit: When you use your aegis to teleport an enemy, that enemy is immobilized until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Binding Initiate
feat.benefit: You gain training in one skill from the Binder Warlock's class skill list.
You also gain proficiency with rods and wands.
In addition, you choose one binder pact. You gain both the at-will attack and the utility power it grants at 1st level as encounter powers.

feat.title: Binding Ritual Mastery
feat.benefit: When interacting with creatures that have an origin other than natural, you can use Arcana or Religion in place of Diplomacy and Intimidate, and gain a +2 bonus to such checks.
Once per day, you can ignore the component cost of a binding ritual of your level or lower that you cast.

feat.title: Binding Style
feat.benefit: While you are wielding both a flait and a spear, you gain the following benefits with martial at-will attacks:

► If you hit a different creature with each weapon, you immobilize the one you hit with your flail. This lasts until the end of your next turn, or until you no longer threaten the creature with your flail, which ever comes first.
► If you hit the same creature with both weapons, you can slide the target 1 square.

feat.title: Binding Wrath
feat.benefit: When you use your armor of wrath, you can immobilize the target untile the end of your next turn instead of dealing damage to it.

feat.title: Bitter Challenge
feat.benefit: Whenever a target takes damage from your Divine Challenge, it is also slowed until the end of its next turn.

feat.title: Bitter Cold
feat.benefit: When you hit a creature with a Cold power from any class that allows you to qualify for this feat, that creature takes a -2 penalty to Fortitude defense until the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Bitter Rebuke
feat.benefit: Your rebuke undead power is modified based on your Divine Covenant:
Covenant of Malediction: A creature hit by your rebuke undead takes a -2 penalty to all attack rolls until the end of your next turn.
Covenant of Preservation: A creature hit by your rebuke undead is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Covenant of Wrath: A creature hit by your rebuke undead is pushed a number of squares equal to 2 + your Consitution modifier instead of only 2 squares.

feat.title: Black Hood Butcher
feat.benefit: When you make a Weapon attack with a two-handed axe that you have proficiency with, you gain the following two benefits:
► If you score a critical hit, each enemy adjacent to you takes damage equal to your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus.
This damage increases to 2 + your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus at 11th level, and to 4 + your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus at 21st level.
► If the attack is against Reflex, you can choose to make it against Fortitude instead. You must make this decision before making the attack roll.

feat.title: Black Hood Executioner
feat.benefit: When you make a Weapon attack with a two-handed axe that you have proficiency with, you gain the following two benefits:
► If you score a critical hit, each enemy adjacent to you takes damage equal to your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus.
This damage increases to 2 + your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus at 11th level, and to 4 + your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus at 21st level.
► If your attack kills an enemy, you can use tactician's command once as a minor action before the end of your next turn.

feat.title: Black Hood Slayer
feat.benefit: When you make a Weapon attack with a two-handed axe that you have proficiency with, you gain the following two benefits:
► If you score a critical hit, each enemy adjacent to you takes damage equal to your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus.
This damage increases to 2 + your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus at 11th level, and to 4 + your Strength modifier + your weapon's enhancement bonus at 21st level.
► You gain a +1 bonus to any move or shift from the attack, but must end the move adjacent to a bloodied enemy.

feat.title: Black Hood Student
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Intimidate checks.
When you make a coup de grace with a two-handed axe that you have proficiency with, you deal an additional +1[W] damage.
This additional damage increases to +2[W] at 21st level.

In addition, when you make an at-will Weapon attack with a two-handed axe that you have proficiency with, you gain a +1 bonus to damage if the target is slowed or prone, or a +2 bonus to damage if the target is helpless or immobilized.
The bonus against a slowed or prone target increases to +2 at 21st level. The bonus against an helpless or immobilized target increases to +4 at 11th level, and to +6 at 21st level.

feat.title: Black Mantle
feat.benefit: While wearing cloth armor or no armor and not using a shield, you gain resist 5 cold and resist 5 necrotic against attacks from your oath target.
These resistances increase to resist 10 at 21st level.
If you already have permanent resist cold or resist necrotic, your resistance instead increases by 5.

feat.title: Black Vistani Cat
feat.benefit: Your evil eye of the Vistani can originate from your active cat familiar.
Using evil eye of the Vistani in this way does not provoke opportunity attacks.

feat.title: Blade Channeling Mastery
feat.benefit: When you use Sorcerous Blade Channeling to make a ranged Sorcerer attack as a melee attack, the target takes a -3 penalty to its first saving throw against the power.
This feat has no effect if the attack does not have a component that a save can end.

feat.title: Blade Initiate
feat.benefit: You gain training in the Arcana skill.
You also gain the initiate's warding power. This power counts as the Swordmage Warding class feature for the purposes of qualifying for feats, etc.
In addition, you gain proficiency in swordmage implements.

power.title: Initiate's Warding
power.fluff: You have studied the warding techniques of swordmages, but cannot reach the reliability expected of them

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a light blade or a heavy blade

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +1 bonus to AC, or a +3 bonus to AC if one hand is free.
You lose the bonus if you are no longer wielding a light blade or heavy blade, and regain it when you again wield one. The effect immediately ends if you fall unconscious.

feat.title: Blade Opportunist
feat.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls for triggered attacks you make with a heavy blade or a light blade.

feat.title: Blade and Buckler Duelist
feat.benefit: When you wield a light shield you are proficient with, you treat the bonus it grants as +2 instead of +1.

feat.title: Blade of the Raven Queen
feat.benefit: Your arcane powers that deal cold damage gain the Necrotic keyword and deal cold and necrotic damage instead.

feat.title: Bladed Fists
feat.benefit: Your unarmed attacks deal 1d6 damage.
In addition, you gain a +2 proficiency bonus to attack rolls you make with unarmed attacks.

feat.title: Bladed Precision
feat.benefit: Your unarmed attacks gain the High Crit weapon property.

feat.title: Bleak Guide's Return
feat.benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with your eyes of the vestige power, the next Warlock encounter attack you use before the end of your next turn is not expended if you miss every target.

feat.title: Bleeding Backstab
feat.benefit: Whenever you deal Sneak Attack damage with a Rogue daily attack power, the target also takes ongoing 5 damage (save ends).
If the attack already deals ongoing damage that has no type, instead increase that ongoing damage by 5.
At 21st level, enemies take a -2 penalty to saves against untyped ongoing damage from your attacks. This penalty does not apply there are other effects in addition to the ongoing damage.

feat.title: Bleeding Precision
feat.benefit: Whenever you hit your quarry with a Ranger daily attack power, the target also takes ongoing 5 damage (save ends).
This ongoing damage increases to 10 at 21st level.
If the attack already deals ongoing damage that has no type, instead increase that ongoing damage by 5.
In addition, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls against your quarry if it is currently suffering from untyped ongoing damage from your attacks.

feat.title: Blessed Scoundrel
feat.benefit: When you use your second chance racial power and the enemy misses with the triggering attack, you can spend a healing surge to regain a number of hit points equal to your healing surge value.
